page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: {FARMING IN MOBBERLEY.} {LAND USE.} In Mobberley and surrounding districts it is a mixed area for farming with no dominant type prevailing, once heavily dependant on dairying this is no longer the case. Although not an intensive arable area a variety of crops are grown - mainly cereal crops (wheat, barley, oats), potatoes and oil seed rape. The predominant land use is grass growing for the dairy industry. Methods of conserving the grass have changed with the emphasis now being on silage rather than hay. {FARM ANIMALS. Farm animals include dairy and beef herds and some farms have a few pigs and sheep there are also some goats in evidence.
